title: Coding an Interactive Social Network
author: Carlos
excerpt: In the concluding part of our interactive social network series, we utilize web-scraped character data and insights from natural language processing to construct a dynamic social network within the Witcher Universe using Pyvis.

title: Interactive Conway Game of Life
author: Carlos
excerpt: Explore Conway's Game of Life in this tutorial. Using JavaScript and mouse-controlled grid coloring, learn to implement an Interactive version of  Conway's Game of Life, a captivating cellular automaton exhibiting complex behavior.

title: Interactive Timelines with Timeline.js
author: Carlos
excerpt: Dive into the past with flair! Unleash the power of Timeline.js to craft immersive, interactive timelines that transform history into a captivating digital narrative. Join us as we explore the art of dynamic storytelling and bring the past to life in just a scroll.

title: Coding an Interactive Particle Simulation
author: Carlos
excerpt: This post introduces a tutorial on coding an interactive particle simulation using JavaScript and HTML5 canvas.

title: Optimizing Matrix-Matrix product
author: Carlos
excerpt: Explore the optimization of matrix-matrix multiplication, a fundamental operation in linear algebra, and discover performance-enhancing techniques.

title: Extracting Character Connections from a Book
author: Carlos
excerpt: In the second part of our social network analysis series, we employ natural language processing (NLP) to unveil character connections within the text of the first Witcher book.

title: Web Scraping: Witcher Wiki
author: Carlos
excerpt: Explore the fundamentals of web scraping, a technique for automated data extraction from websites. Demonstrated through extracting character data from the Witcher Wiki, it serves as the initial installment in a three-part series on social network analysis.
